ads.author: Ethan Perdue
ads.title: Theatre of Magic Pinball Machine- Lots of Brass
ads.description:
For Sale: Theatre of Magic pinball machine. Asking $7900. Lots of brass. Most affordable on the internet. Located in Auburn, AL.

Was in the tournament area at SFGE. It is a very reliable machine. I have replaced the trunk, decals, and glass within the last year. Playfield looks good. Plastics look good. Full LED. Recent rubber kit. Cliffys installed at the trunk and basement. 

The bad: 

Four of the lights on the Mirror mod are not working. I have not investigated the issue.

There is a decal cover on the playfield at the drain (pictured). I do not know what is under it. I’m not going to find out what is under it. 

There is some wear on the lockbar from use (pictured). 

The left side on the backbox has a touched up area. I owned this for about 2 years before I noticed it (pictured).

It is a great machine. It is my most reliable pin. I am asking $7900 cash on the glass. I will not ship it. If you want it shipped, have your shipper show up with $7900, and my responsibility ends when I see tail lights. I would prefer to see this go to someone that wants this pin and not someone trying to flip it. 

Trades I will consider:

1) The Getaway. I want one with a good original playfield. I don’t mind a little dirt, but I don’t want diamond bubbles around inserts. Obviously cash my way as well. 

2) Fire Champagne Edition, preferably is as rough as possible but complete. Obviously with cash my way as well.

3) Fathom, also preferred to be rough but complete with cash my way. 

I’m having space issues, so I’m not interested in taking multiples. I would prefer a cash deal. If you have any questions please ask.

The vault Luci has the gawd awful ugly black band around the lower playfield with all the screws holding it in. The original is the Luci to have if you can find one.\n\nMany tasteful mods including chrome stage cover, cannon, \

ads.author: David Peck
ads.title: Commercial Arcade Game
ads.description: Commercial Cruis'n Exotica arcade game. Makes a great Christmas gift! Takes quarters or can be set for free play. Plays and looks great! Perfect for man cave or home arcade.

ads.author: Travis Bordelon
ads.title: 1972 Bally Amigo Pinball Machine
ads.description: I have been having this for 40years, still works! Long ago was rigged to be able to play for free, but I'm sure it can be reversed. It is a 4 Player, and I have a 12 page wiring schematic for it bc recently I was gonna refurbish it being it's a childhood relic, it's heavy, I changed all the light bulbs and rubber bands 2 years ago but there are 2 little components that kick the ball out in the front and one in the rear of the playing field that come to find out still work but lost a neutral somewhere in it's wiring hornace, and the right flipper actually just stopped last week but i suppose its something simple i just dont have the time or the extensive knowledge for old school mechanical electronics. It's all delicate but otherwise still works 75\u0025 I'd say....would be a great conversation piece, altho the theme is really not THAT highly sought after such as a Playboy or StarWars ones,and all the new ones are all digital and don't have all these cool old school mechanical electronics like this one does and can still play today!! The playing field glass slides down and then opens like the hood of a car with a prop and all to be able to maintenance, and the back panel of the scoreboard still has the key in its panel as well as the main entry keys!! Own a piece of HISTORY TODAY!!!! Price negotiable!

ads.author: Troy Cook
ads.title: Bally Gold Ball
ads.description:
Up for sell is a rarely seen Gold Ball pinball.
There were only 1750 games made in 1983.
The game is unique in that the gold ball is introduced randomly after the regular ball drains, tripling the score during gold ball play.
The game has been previously shopped out, has a remote battery and is set to free play.
Game is in overall nice condition with the cabinet showing some nicks, dings and fade.
The backglass is in good condition.

ads.author: Eric Cannon
ads.title: Custom Tron Legacy legends pinball
ads.description: Almost finished custom Tron Legacy legends pinball. The pc is not included but an uninstalled solenoid system for the flippers is included to give authentic knocking sound and vibration when the flipper buttons are pressed. The flipper buttons are leaf switch buttons and the rest of the controls are included along with the complete control board interface including plunger and launch button. The audio system has also been upgraded as well. Almost finished the project but lost interest as I have moved on to other arcade projects.

ads.author: Allen Robinson
ads.title: Sea Wolf, Upright Arcade, Midway 1976
ads.description:
Vintage Upright Arcade – Sea Wolf, Midway, April 1976, Underwater Shooter.
Price: $500, Negotiable (but not by much)
Own a piece of arcade history! This is an original Sea Wolf upright cabinet, a classic submarine-themed shooter from the late 1970s. Players look through a periscope to fire torpedoes at enemy ships — a true icon of the golden age of gaming.
Condition:
- Cabinet is very old and needs some love.
- Boards need work and likely new caps.
- Monitor and lights power on.
- Sound worked a few months ago, but currently not functioning.
- Sold as-is, perfect for restoration enthusiasts or collectors.
Highlights:
- Rare upright arcade cabinet with iconic gameplay.
- Great project piece for anyone into vintage electronics or arcade restoration.
- Even in current condition, it makes a fantastic display piece.
Important:
- Price is negotiable, but only slightly.
- Serious buyers only.

ads.author: Rob LaDue
ads.title: 😍❤️☠️ Black Rose Pinball Machine - Pirate Themed
ads.description:
😍❤️❤️ Gorgeous Black Rose Pinball Machine ⚔️☠️🪓 -Pirate Themed

This beautiful Black Rose, pirate-themed☠️, pinball machine was produced in 1992 and features many unique game elements, including a pop-up twisting cannon shot to sink ships and shoot bonus shots, video-mode bonus games (uses the flippers to play a Knife Throwing, Walk-the-Plank, and Swing-from-the-Rigging analog video game), Easter-egg bonuses for trick shots, treasure bonuses, parrot bonus, etc. Play is flawless!  All plastics and metals are in great condition, and the lights, cannon, analog display, 3 flippers, plunger, sound, and ball eject perform perfectly. Complete Operations Manual included.

This machine has been lovingly used for home play since our purchase of it in 2008.  We are a smoke free home. At the time of purchase, the machine had been completely shopped, including replacing many of the older incandescent lighting with LEDs.  Some of the incandescent lights were retained to provide some of that old school pinball feel.  All rubbers were replaced last year, a pinball specialist gave it a once over in December 2024, and the field was recently rewaxed.  The cabinet and playfield are near flawless and the legs are free of rust.

Before being returned to the States for its reshop in 2007, this machine was exported to Italy.  It retains its original Italian lire coin return buttons. The game speaks and displays English (go figure!😆). The coin change box was missing when we acquired it, but is easily found on the internet.

For an older (and more affordable) pinball game, Black Rose has so-ooo many different and unique elements and shots, that our family never got tired of it (our moving necessitates the sale).  The pirate theme is exciting for both adults and children too and for those that desire, the game can be upgraded with the Skull and Bones kit, which changes the game in many interesting ways.

Please message me with any questions and I will do the best I can to answer them.  Play tests can also be arranged (located in Bradenton, FL).  Shipping must be arranged by the buyer.  

Beautiful machine! ☠️❤️ Thanks!

*New CPU/driver board combo.

*Recapped sound board.

*New shooter rod springs and coin door lock.

*New flipper buttons.

*Glow in the dark Titan rubbers, new post caps, and new lane guides.

*Rebuilt flippers and new drop target decals.

*New legs, leg bolts, leg bolt washers, and leg levelers.

Asking $1,500. Pickup in Adairsville, GA. Easy load out and will help load. Can deliver for small fee. More pictures are available upon request.

ads.author: Max Johnson
ads.title: WANTED: FIRE! pinball machine
ads.description: I am re-starting a program where I place a FIRE! pinball machine in a fire station on $.50 per play.  At the end of the month, I count the quarters, match the amount, and then donate it to the charity of the stations choice.  The game gives the guys something to do when they arent working, and the proceeds help others.  I did this many years ago and it was a very successful event.  I rotate the game into another fire station every 60 days.  I need two or three more machines (FIRE!) due to the sheer number of fire stations there are.  I cant pay top dollar because this is for non profit.  I restore each of these games before they are placed so that they look good and are less likely to fail.  I of course pay for all the repairs.  There is NO cost to the firefighters, other than paying fifty cents (or donating $.50) to a charity.   If you know of anyone who has a FIRE! pinball and would like it to go to a very good cause, let me know.

My firm prices are generally in the pinside average window. Not the top price but not the bottom price either. Somewhere in the middle. I'm looking to get a fair price. 

>>>>>>I will NOT entertain any offers. The listed price is the price for the game.<<<<<

Terminator 3. Chrome edition signed by Steve Ritchie. It's one of 50 made by Jersey. Jack back when he was selling pinball games. It's very rare. $5,000 

Who dunnit is in great shape. The reels work as they should and the game has been 100% reliable. It's in beautiful condition. $4,000

Punchy the clown is one of 103 made. It works excellent and has been fully led. $3,500 

Hard body 1987 is in good condition and was restored a couple years ago. It's fully led and works well. A fairly rare game that's hard to find in this condition. $2,500 

NBA Fast break. Works excellent. Looks good. Plays well and always reliable. $3,900 

Bally spectrum. A super rare game that was restored by a gentleman in Alabama. He used all yopicles instead of conventional incandescent bulbs. The restoration is amazing. $4,900 

2014 Stern mustang pro. This is one of 50 made on the anniversary of the mustang. It has a plaque on the speaker board below the back glass designating it as a special edition. It's quite rare. You don't see these come up for sale often. $6,500 

Stern Munsters pro. Great condition. Has a few mods plays 100%. No issues or excuses. $6,000.

Stern AC/DC Lucy edition. This the much better original edition not the later one. It has a few mods and plays really well. Color, DMD, pin, sound speakers and so much more. $10,000 

Jurassic Park pro. Great condition plays perfectly. $6,000.

Stern Harley-Davidson second edition plays great and looks good! $4,100 

Firepower. Restored by arcade artifacts out of Pennsylvania about 2 years ago. The restoration is incredible and you can find a video on YouTube showing the details of the restoration. It's the nicest firepower you will see. $5,000.

Stern CSI. Fully LED plays beautifully and looks good. No excuses. $4,500.

World poker tour. Great game! Super fun! Some mods including an alternate back glass translite. I will also include the original translite. $3,500 

Stern NBA. Super rare game plays and looks fine. $4,700.

Big indian electromechanical game. Works perfectly. No issues. $1,300.

Monster bash original 1998 looks good. Plays great. $8,000.

Pinball adventures punny factory. This is the limited edition engraved cabinet. It's very unique. Super Super rare game. Game works 100%. I guarantee you'll be the only one of your friends with this game! $7,000.

ads.author: Steve Thorson
ads.title: Star Wars ep.1 Pinball Machine
ads.description:
In great shape and fully working. Minor playfield wear from normal use.
All lights, switches, sounds, mechs, light saber, and features work 100%. Playfield lights have been converted to LED for improved reliability and brightness.

Released in 1999, this game holds a unique place in pinball history as the final game ever produced by Williams, the last remaining manufacturer of the Golden Age of pinball. It’s also one of only two pinball machines ever made to feature an interactive hologram projected onto the playfield, making it not just historically significant, but innovative and a genuinely fun game to play.

Would make a great addition to a game room or Christmas gift for a Star Wars fan.

Open to trades for other pinball machines.

ads.author: Jarad Keegan
ads.title: 1990 Whirlwind Williams pinball machine
ads.description: Up for your consideration is my whirlwind machine. Very clean playfield and cabinet, no major dings or scratches. Has pedretti 2.0 total chaos installed. All new comet LEDs and orange silicon rubbers throughout. Plays great. Looking to sell or trade for jaws 50th premium, attack from mars, cirqus voltaire, twilight zone. Will add cash on my end

ads.author: Kenny Burke
ads.title: Royal Rumble Pinball
ads.description: Royal Rumball widebody pinball machine in excellent shape. This is a fun and fast pin and has a shaker motor too. Everything works like new. Just finished a full clean and wax of both playfields. Has new rubbers, balls and all lights have been swapped to led except the flashers. Switches have been cleaned and adjusted so it plays great. Power supply board has been upgraded to the Rottendog one and has the nvram chip installed so no worry about battery damage in the future or … See more
